abstract: The peculiar deal between the router giant Cisco and the seven-employee Utah Street Networks, the owner of the also-ran social networking site Tribe.net, was formally announced Monday after having been revealed by The New York Times on Saturday. The price was not disclosed, but it was surely less than a rounding error for a company the size of Cisco. Still, the sale got noticed, if only because of the snarky commentary it elicited from Netscape cofounder Marc Andreessen.
lead_paragraph: The peculiar deal between the router giant Cisco and the seven-employee Utah Street Networks, the owner of the also-ran social networking site Tribe.net, was formally announced Monday after having been revealed by The New York Times on Saturday. The price was not disclosed, but it was surely less than a rounding error for a company the size of Cisco. Still, the sale got noticed, if only because of the snarky commentary it elicited from Netscape cofounder Marc Andreessen.

headline.main: The Odd Couple of Social Networking
